2008/7/14 Sergio Bobillier <sergio.bobillier@...>:
> Would you say that is better to write separate test cases?

I would prefer separate test cases.

If the two scenarios are tested in the same test case, as in the
example you gave, I have to carefully read through the code and run it
in my head to see what is actually being tested and therefore
understand the intended behaviour of the class under test.  If each
scenario is in its own test case, each test case can be given a name
that clearly communicates what is being tested.

--Nat
